intro: Piqueria latifolia var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth piqueria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its broad, smooth leaves and yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. The species is known for its adaptability to drought conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
